alert.note: Alert for Comal (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 24 at 7:51PM CST until January 25 at 9:40PM CST by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following counties, Bexar and Comal. * WHEN...Until 1100 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 751 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Antonio, New Braunfels, Schertz, Cibolo, Universal City, Live Oak, Selma, San Antonio Int Airport, Randolph AFB, Stinson Municipal Airport, Canyon Lake Dam, Canyon Lake, Leon Valley, Helotes, Fair Oaks Ranch, Kirby, Alamo Heights, Windcrest, Terrell Hills and Bulverde. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
